abstract: In Hollywood, media executives are eagerly preparing for a new era as they hope to position more content where consumers want it: in their hands.
snippet: In Hollywood, media executives are eagerly preparing for a new era as they hope to position more content where consumers want it: in their hands.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, June 24 — The iPhone doesn’t go on sale until Friday, but Steven P. Jobs, the chief executive of Apple, is already changing the perception of the mobile phone, from a quick way to call a friend to a hip, media-friendly device. In doing so, he has forced mobile phone and Hollywood executives to react by chasing hungrily after the newest thing or face being left behind.

headline.main: Hollywood Seeks Ways to Fit Its Content Into the Realm of the iPhone
headline.print_headline: Hollywood Seeks Ways to Fit Its Content Into the Realm of the iPhone
